page.title: 11IRONBRIDGE POWER STATION
page.content: The old Ironbridge Power Station was built in the 1920s and pulled down one year ago. The present Ironbridge Power Station was built in 1968. It took 8_10 years to build with 1 thousand men working on it. The Power Station is built on a 212 acre site. The Power Station itself occupies 110 acres of the site. There are four cooling towers at the Power Station each 88 metres wide and 114 metres high. The stack at the Ironbridge Power Station is one of the highest in Europe. The Power Station generates 25,000 volts. It is then transformed into 400,000 volts, each house only has 240 volts. 70,000 tons of coal go to the Power Station a week.
